description.narrative: The Dutch government is committed to the development and implementation of agreements between companies, social organizations, trade unions and government in the field of International Corporate Social Responsibility (IMVO) and it granted a subsidy of EUR 996.346to ensure a structured and professional involvement of civil society and trade unions in the preparation of IMVO covenants in the Netherlands. The subsidy is Intended for Dutch based established civil society organizations involved in the IMVO Covenant negotiations. The current covenant trajectories are on: Nutrition, insurers, gold, floriculture, sustainable natural stone. The administration of the funds is operated by Oxfam Novib on request of the MVO Platform and the Ministry.

participating-org.narrative:
The National India Working Group (LIW) is a human rights organization that defends the interests of the lawless and marginalized groups in South Asia. The LIW does this through social and political advocacy and (policy) influence, research, information, publicityand publicity campaigns. She works closely with local organizations in India and organizations in the Netherlands, Europe and internationally. The four core themes of the LIW are:
Child Labor and Education Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) in sectors such asclothing, natural stone, seeds and tea Dalits / Kastelozen Human rights: Indian policy and practice These themes have been at the heart of the LIW's work for 15 to 20 years. A small organization can only be effective if it makes a long-term commitment to one or more themes and as a result builds up a great deal of expertise, a good network and strong coalitions. In the past it was mainly national together with a few Indian organizations, now it is increasingly in European and international coalitions. Over the years, moreand more cross-connections between our themes have emerged and therefore more opportunities for action and influence. Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR), for example, also plays a major role in banning childlabor and caste discrimination. In addition, we specifically look at child labor and access to education of Dalit children and use that knowledge in our CSR activities.
The geographical focus of the LIW is shifting from India to South Asia. The political-economic relations of India with countries in the region havebecome more important. In addition, our themes are not limited to India but also very relevant to other South Asian countries. Discrimination against Dalits occurs throughout South Asia andlabor rights violations in the clothing and textile industry are a regional issue.
The LIW cooperates with a wide range of organizations that are committed to global justice. Collaboration with local organizations is of great importance to gain insight into human rights and labor rights violations in India / South Asia and to take action together. Based on the expertise that has been accumulated over the past 40 years, the LIW from the Netherlands contributes to solutions for the problems identified by local NGOs.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation

description.narrative: Strengthened CSOs: # CSOs increasingly participate in or initiate influencing and advocacy efforts on promotion of a transparent, accountable and inclusive financial sector and/or on promotion of financial inclusion of people living in poverty.
